slogan: Frontend Developer ‚Äî sharp logic, instinctive problem-solver
intro:
I think like a developer, design like a user, and solve like someone who sees beyond the bug.

Every line of code I write has intention. I learn what the project needs and apply it right when it matters. I don‚Äôt collect tools. I transform.

I‚Äôm in a polishing phase, yes. But I already bring value, structure, and direction. I‚Äôm not a finished product. I‚Äôm evolution with character.

And what I carry inside... that can‚Äôt be taught.

2018.title: Versatile beginnings
2018.description: I started my professional journey in administration and customer service roles, developing key skills in organization, communication, and problem-solving.

2022.title: Turning to tech
2022.description: I began formal training in software development, combining my background with studies in programming, databases, and user interface design.

2023.title: Hands-on experience
2023.description: I joined a real dev team for my internship, contributing to frontend and backend modules, working in Agile sprints and real product delivery cycles.

2024.title: Web developer role
2024.description: I joined a corporate web project, working on a custom internal framework, delivering new features, integrating APIs, and improving user experience in Agile teams.

2025.title: Refinement and growth
2025.description: I strengthen my technical and creative identity with the launch of this portfolio and deepening specialization in modern frontend. I'm evolution in motion.

motivacionTexto:
I never imagined I‚Äôd end up in the world of web development.

For years, I moved between patients, paperwork, logistics and people. I did a bit of everything: caring, organizing, solving. I liked making things work for others.

But something inside me asked for more. More creativity, more challenge, more future.

I started exploring what else was out there‚Äîsomething I didn‚Äôt know yet, but that could connect with who I already am and let me be even more of it.

I discovered that programming wasn‚Äôt just writing code. It was solving problems, designing experiences, improving systems and understanding needs.

I didn‚Äôt leave behind who I was. I transformed it.

Today I don‚Äôt care for patients, but I still listen. I don‚Äôt manage documents, but I organize logic. I don‚Äôt translate languages, but I turn ideas into interfaces.

Code also cares, organizes and solves. But it also builds. And for someone like me, that was a revolution.

This is not a career change. It‚Äôs evolution with purpose.

Since then, I haven‚Äôt stopped. Not just learning, but imagining. Because now I finally know I can create what I used to just manage.
contactoTexto:
I didn‚Äôt come to please.

I‚Äôm not for everyone.
